title: World Breads Quiz
description: Every culture has its bread — can you match these breads to their countries of origin?

questions.question: Lavash is a thin, soft flatbread that is a staple in which country's cuisine?
Which braided Swiss bread, traditionally eaten on Sundays, is called Zopf?
options: A braided white bread enriched with butter and eggs

questions.question: Damper is a traditional soda bread made by which group of people?
Which Middle Eastern bread is round, flat, and puffs up when baked, creating a pocket?
Roti is an unleavened flatbread eaten daily in which countries?
Which Finnish rye bread has a distinctive round shape with a hole in the center?
Mantou is a steamed bread (bun) that is a staple in which country?
Which Portuguese sweet bread, often made for Easter, is known as Folar?
options: A sweet bread sometimes with a whole egg baked inside

questions.question: Lefse is a traditional soft flatbread made from potatoes in which Scandinavian country?
Which Central Asian bread, baked in a tandoor oven, is round with a decorated center?
Arepa is a cornmeal bread that is a daily staple in which South American countries?
Which Italian Christmas bread from Milan is tall, dome-shaped, and studded with dried fruits?
Irish soda bread uses which leavening agent instead of yeast?
Chapati and paratha are both unleavened breads. What makes paratha different from chapati?
options: It is always stuffed with meat
It is made with rice flour
It is baked in an oven
It is layered and often fried with oil or ghee

questions.question: Which German bread, called Vollkornbrot, is a dense, dark bread made entirely from what?
